history.content:
Hi there, please try searching for similar posts before posting as this question has been answered multiple times.

Are you enrolled in the class? If so, you can use the edit function to switch secondary sections without dropping and re-adding. Just beware that in the new system, once a waitlist is formed everyone is sent to the waitlist. So if you change to a different lab, you will be sent to the waitlist, but at #1. Then once the waitlist is processed automatically at 8AM and 5PM daily, you'll be enrolled as long as the sections you chose are open.

If you are waitlisted, the only way to switch secondary sections is to drop and re-add the class.

children.subject: What do you mean by the switch failing? If there's room in the section into which you're trying to switch, you would be enrolled once the waitlist is processed automatically. If it's full, you would be dropped from the class.

By failing I mean being enrolled in the class and section, and then trying to switch into a full section (e.g. There are two open spots but three people who are also already enrolled and trying to switch into this section).

So would you then be waitlisted in the course? Dropped? Would the switch not actually take place since there weren't enough spots (still enrolled in the same section as before)?
 I'm trying to weigh how risky switching into a different section would be.

Sorry for the confusion

If you tried to switch into a full section, you would be dropped to the waitlist, but I'm not sure at which position. I would assume #1. I don't believe there's a notification that warns you that you're about to be dropped if you try to switch into a full section, so you should check schedule.berkeley.edu for enrollment numbers since that site is live.

There is something called a future swap, which will swap your enrolled class for another class, only if the one you want opens; however I think that is for swapping an entire class, not switching secondary sections. 

I wish I understood the new system better! Any who has experience these situations, please weigh in.

Has there been any update on whether you will get dropped from the class if the section you want to switch into fills up? I want to switch into another section for 186 (I'm already enrolled), but it only has 2 open seats as well and 14 people on the waitlist.

Thanks for the detailed response about how the waitlists work! (That should go somewhere more general, I found it helpful and read this post by accident!)

Quick question: If you switch into a different lab using the edit function, and then that switch fails when the waitlists are processed, what happens? Do you get booted to the sections waitlist (and hopefully still enrolled in the class) or returned to the section you were previously in?

From what I've gathered:

Yes, you will be on the first position on the waitlist.

Once the waitlist processes, you'll be enrolled, because there's now 1 open seat for 5th-6th semester L&S CS students (i.e. your former seat).

Hi! So I'm a LS CS major (semester 5) who is currently enrolled in 16A.

I'm considering switching my lab. Will I be pushed onto #1 in the watlist for lecture as well? If so, at 5 PM, even if there is space in the section and lab I plan to switch into, I won't be enrolled right? Since the number of seats reserved for LS CS 5-6 semester students is full

Thanks!

Switching Sections

Is it possible to switch sections without dropping the class entirely and losing waitlist position?

Switch disscussion section without losing spot on waitlist

The disscussion section I currently have down for CS 188 has now been filled up. 

How do I change the section to something else so that I can get into the class? I do not want to lose my spot on the waitlist.

history.content: Is it possible to switch secondary sections without dropping and re-adding the class? I phase I'd EE 16B (I'm an EECS freshman) and both my discussion and lab are full (I successfully enrolled in both), but I want to switch into another lab time that's open. I'm just worried about losing my spot in my discussion section if I drop and re-add, but I want to switch lab times before the other lab fills up.
history.subject: Switching Secondary Sections
